issues.description: In the template repository the StockIngredient getter for the ingredient name is named getIngredientName(), and Stock.findStockIngredient() calls getIngredientName(). In the solution repository the getter was renamed to getName(), and Stock.findStockIngredient() was changed accordingly to call getName(). This yields a cross-artifact method-name mismatch for the same accessor (StockIngredient.getIngredientName() vs StockIngredient.getName()). The problem statement asks students to "add getters for all the private fields" but does not specify the exact getter names, so students working from the template will implement and use getIngredientName(), while the solution demonstrates getName(). This inconsistency can confuse students when they compare their code to the reference solution or when automated checks/reference tests expect a specific method name.
issues.suggested_fix:
Unify the accessor name for the ingredient's name across template, solution, and any documentation. Two options:
- Preferred: Use getName() consistently (rename getIngredientName() -> getName() in the template and update any references such as Stock.findStockIngredient to call getName()).
- Alternative: Revert the solution to use getIngredientName() so it matches the template (rename getName() -> getIngredientName() in the solution and update references).
Also clarify in the problem statement that students should add standard getters (e.g., getName()) for private fields to avoid ambiguous naming.

issues.description: The name getter for StockIngredient is inconsistent across artifacts: the template repository defines the getter as getIngredientName(), while the solution repository uses getName(). The problem statement asks to "add getters for all the private fields" but does not prescribe the exact getter name, which leaves ambiguity. This divergence forces students to reconcile two different identifier names for the same conceptual field (the ingredient's name) and may cause confusion when reading template code, implementing their own getters, or comparing with the provided solution.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the getter name for the ingredient's name across artifacts. Prefer the conventional getter name getName(): rename getIngredientName() in the template StockIngredient to getName(), and update any references (e.g., Stock.findStockIngredient) to call getName(). Alternatively, if you choose getIngredientName(), update the solution to use getIngredientName() consistently. This removes the mapping ambiguity and aligns with the instruction to add getters for private fields.
